<a id="Shortcut"></a>

# Shortcut

**Inherits:** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A shortcut for binding input.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Shortcuts (also known as hotkeys) are containers of [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) resources. They are commonly used to interact with a [Control](Control.md) element from an [InputEvent](InputEvent.md).

One shortcut can contain multiple [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) resources, making it possible to trigger one action with multiple different inputs.

\ **Example:** Capture the :kbd:`Ctrl + S` shortcut using a **Shortcut** resource:




```gdscript
    extends Node

    var save_shortcut = Shortcut.new()
    func _ready():
        var key_event = InputEventKey.new()
        key_event.keycode = KEY_S
        key_event.ctrl_pressed = true
        key_event.command_or_control_autoremap = true # Swaps Ctrl for Command on Mac.
        save_shortcut.events = [key_event]

    func _input(event):
        if save_shortcut.matches_event(event) and event.is_pressed() and not event.is_echo():
            print("Save shortcut pressed!")
            get_viewport().set_input_as_handled()
```


```csharp
    using Godot;

    public partial class MyNode : Node
    {
        private readonly Shortcut _saveShortcut = new Shortcut();

        public override void _Ready()
        {
            InputEventKey keyEvent = new InputEventKey
            {
                Keycode = Key.S,
                CtrlPressed = true,
                CommandOrControlAutoremap = true, // Swaps Ctrl for Command on Mac.
            };

            _saveShortcut.Events = [keyEvent];
        }

        public override void _Input(InputEvent @event)
        {
            if (@event is InputEventKey keyEvent &&
                _saveShortcut.MatchesEvent(@event) &&
                keyEvent.Pressed && !keyEvent.Echo)
            {
                GD.Print("Save shortcut pressed!");
                GetViewport().SetInputAsHandled();
            }
        }
    }
```

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="Shortcut_property_events"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Array](Array.md) **events** = `[]` [ðŸ”—](#Shortcut_property_events)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_events**\ (\ value\: [Array](Array.md)\ )
- [Array](Array.md) **get_events**\ (\ )

The shortcut's [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) array.

Generally the [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) used is an [InputEventKey](InputEventKey.md), though it can be any [InputEvent](InputEvent.md), including an [InputEventAction](InputEventAction.md).

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="Shortcut_method_get_as_text"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_as_text**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Shortcut_method_get_as_text)

Returns the shortcut's first valid [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) as a [String](String.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Shortcut_method_has_valid_event"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **has_valid_event**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Shortcut_method_has_valid_event)

Returns whether [events](Shortcut.md#Shortcut_property_events) contains an [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) which is valid.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Shortcut_method_matches_event"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **matches_event**\ (\ event\: [InputEvent](InputEvent.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Shortcut_method_matches_event)

Returns whether any [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) in [events](Shortcut.md#Shortcut_property_events) equals `event`. This uses [InputEvent.is_match()](InputEvent.md#InputEvent_method_is_match) to compare events.
